Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, while reviewing the operation's recreation documents it was discovered two children in care recreation sheets had incorrect placement dates.
Correction Narrative: The mistake was corrected in the entry on the child records, indicating the correct placement date. The operation will review all recreation documents to ensure the correct placement dates are documented. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the Compliance Officer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, it was discovered while reviewing the recreation binder that 6 of the  6 children currently placed in the operation does not have a daily indoor/outdoor recreational activity scheduled. The recreation binder included the month of February recreation.
Correction Narrative: A monthly recreation calendar will be created and kept for review and posted in the general recreation areas. The supervisor will complete the calendars on a quarterly basis and file in binder and post in the designated areas.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's prescription medications were not stored in the original medication bottle. The child was discharged on 2/24/2025 from the operation, then temporarily re-admitted to the operation. During the discharge, all medication bottles were returned to the CVS worker. When the child was re-admitted, the operation staff accepted medications provided in a pill reminder box and not the original packaging.
Correction Narrative: During a follow up inspection it was noted that all medications reviewed and counted were in their original medication bottle and appropriately labeled.

Deficiency Narrative: A child s medication record for a prescription medication did not match the medication count. The medication record indicated there were 44 pills remaining while the bottle only contained 12 pills.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection all medications and medication logs were without error.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's medication record for a prescription medication indicated the dosage was increased to 2 pills every night beginning on 2/12/2025. The child was only administered 2 pills on that evening. The following days from 2/12/2025 to 2/24/2025, the child was administered 1 pill despite the documented medication changes.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection there was no discrepancies regarding how the medication will be administered to the children in care. The medication logs coincided with the medication counts.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed all fire extinguishers mounted for emergency use were due for maintenance in January 2025,  All extinguishers were 12 days overdue for maintenance.
Correction Narrative: On 2/20/25, the operation provided photographic proof of the fire extinguishers having been retagged and indicated they were serviced on 2/14/25.  Prevention of recurrence includes scheduling inspection at least 30 days prior to the next service date and administrator noting on the calendar the date they notify the maintenance company of the need for inspection.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a child in care was arrested on 2/8/25, and the operation failed to report this incident to the hotline.
Correction Narrative: On 2/20/25, the operation provided a correction plan by email.  The incident in question was reported to the hotline on 2/10/25 following my inspection of the operation.  Preventative measures include efforts to hire a qualified Treatment Director and intention to train said Treatment Director in reporting guidelines and timeframe requirements.  The operation held a mandatory meeting on 2/16/25 to re-educate all staff on Serious Incident Reporting procedures.  A sign in sheet for the meeting was provided and uploaded to document library.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, a staff member admitted to assisting the victim child in exiting the operation without verifying the child was under continued supervision, resulting in the child with known running behaviors leaving the grounds and running away.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up, the administrator confirmed a meeting was held on 2/10/25 wherein administration issued directives to the caregivers stating children were not to be allowed outside the building without proper supervision.  The offending staff's employment was terminated on 2/10/25.  This brings this standard back into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report the quarterly EBI data timely.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email stating a reminder will be added to the Administrator's calendar when EBI Quarterly report is due. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the Compliance Officer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection child records were requested; however, a child service plan was requested at the beginning of the inspection, 9:30 am, however, it wasn't received until 11:45 am. Although, the child's folder was provided at the beginning of the inspection, the service plan was not included.
Correction Narrative: The Treatment Director and Intake Team will be in-serviced on the process. The Admissions Team will audit the resident's files within seven days of admission to ensure all the required information is filed in the resident's file. The Treatment Director and Intake Team will be re-educated, and ongoing resident file auditing will be conducted, with ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the Compliance Officer.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four child records reviewed was missing a parent signature on the placement agreement.
Correction Narrative: The Treatment Director and Intake Team will be in-serviced on the process for compliance. The Admissions Team will review the documents upon receipt to ensure all the required information is present. If the information is not included in the submitted documentation, the Admission Team will notify the Caseworker/Supervisor to request the missing information be provided as required. The email request for the missing information will be documented in the resident's chart. The Admissions Team will continue to follow-up until the information is received and document all correspondence in the resident's chart.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four child records reviewed did not include a TB test exam or results for a child in care.
Correction Narrative:
The resident reviewed was sent for a TB test but was admitted to a BHC facility at the time the test was to be read. The resident was taken for the screening and the negative results was placed in the resident's chart. 
The Admissions Team will audit resident files within seven days of admission to the facility. All scheduled appointments, follow-up and missed appointments will be placed on the universal calendar to generate reminders/alerts for staff. Ongoing re-education/in-services/auditing of records will be provided by the Administrator or designee. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator, RN, and the Compliance Officer. 
A copy of the child's TB test results was provided on 12/30/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the four child records reviewed failed to indicate the reason for the placement on the Placement Agreement.
Correction Narrative: The Treatment Director and Intake Team will be in-serviced on the process for compliance. The Admissions Team will review the documents upon receipt to ensure all the required information is present. If the information is not included in the submitted documentation, the Admission Team will notify the Caseworker/Supervisor to request the missing information be provided as required. The email request for the missing information will be documented in the resident's chart. The Admissions Team will continue to follow-up until the information is received and document all correspondence in the resident's chart.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, a hole was located behind the door in the unisex shower bathroom. The operation did not have a work order for this damage.
Correction Narrative: The operation staff will conduct daily facility checks on each shift. The work order to repair the hole was submitted, and the area was repaired the next day. Work orders for repairs will be submitted immediately to the Administration Team. The work order form will be revised to include the time/date the repair was found. The work order will be submitted to the maintenance crew withing 24 hours.

Deficiency Narrative: Four of the four records reviewed did not include documentation that invites to service plan meetings were sent to the child's parent.
Correction Narrative: The Treatment Director and Intake Team will be in-serviced on the process for compliance. The Admissions Team will schedule the invites and utilize the facility's universal calendar to place the invite date and time. The email confirmation will be filed in the resident's chart. Auditing of admission charts will be performed within 7 days of admission to the facility by the Administrator or Designated Team Leader. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the Compliance Officer.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing documentation, I observed a child's Initial Service Plan was completed on day 57 after admission to the operation.
Correction Narrative: On 2/10/25, the operation provided a written correction plan detailing measures taken to prevent missed service plan dates in the future.  The plan indicates the admission team enters projected due dates for the service plans in the Outlook Calendar at admission and sends out appropriate invites to the meeting.  A meeting was held on 2/7/25 by the CEO and the Administrator to review and retrain relevant staff regarding expected time frames for service plan completion.  A sign in sheet was provided.  The operation also indicated the Compliance Officer/Case Management Team/Administrator will review and audit the Initial Service Plans within 24-48 hours of completion to ensure reflected dates and times are accurate.  The operation indicates the reviewed file contained a clerical error and was completed on 11/28/24 as opposed to 12/18/24 (the date recorded on the plan).  The plan states the mistake in entry was not identified until after the RCCR review.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the four children interviewed reported that a staff member used profane language towards a child in care. Both children reported the same staff and child in their report of the incident.
Correction Narrative: On 1/30/2025, I conducted an inspection and spoke with three children in care regarding the standard cited. The operation conducted a mandatory training on appropriate communication, de-escalation techniques, and child interaction with the staff. A one-on-one coaching session with the staff and supervisor to review the facility policies on professional behavior and how to effectively handle challenging situations. The staff was placed on a behavior monitoring period in which the interactions between the staff and children will be closely monitored. The staff was given a formal written warning. A shift evaluation log was provided. The operation provided a sign in sheet of all participants in which all staff attended a training on 1/25/2025 on Prohibition of Abuse or Profane Language.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through, a closet containing several chemicals was observed unlocked and accessible to children in the laundry room.

During the walk-through, the freezer thermometer indicated the freezer was ten degrees Fahrenheit. The thermometer log on the outside of the freezer indicated the temperatures on several days was not in range.
Correction Narrative: All dietary/food handlers will be re-educated on MS 748.3443(b)(2). The dietary lead completed the work order for the refrigerator and freezer to be serviced. On 11/15/2024, the refrigerator and freezer were within the appropriate range.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing employee records, one of the four records reviewed indicated three attempts were made to contact a previous employer during the same time frame each day. Documentation in the file indicated an email would be sent to the previous employer to request a reference; however, there was no documentation that an email had been sent.
Correction Narrative: The HR Manager followed up with an email on 11/14/2024 and placed the email request within the employees HR folder.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through, a child was observed lying on his mattress that was located on the floor in his room.
Correction Narrative: The mattress was placed back on the bed by the staff. The resident and staff were reminded that residents should not remove the mattress from the bed and educated on the reasons why the mattress should not be on the floor. All staff will be re-educated on this standard.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through, three of the four child medications and medication records were reviewed and indicated the pill counts were not accurate. One child s record stated 19 pills, however, the count indicated there were 18. Another child s medication record said there were 19 pills, but there were 20 pills. A third child s medication record indicated there were 44 pills and there were 46 pills.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, three child medications and medication records were reviewed, and were found to be without error.

Deficiency Narrative: Out of the five child records reviewed, three did not have the necessary suicide screenings documented.
Correction Narrative:
Admission/intake staff will be re-educated on admission process to include but not limited to: timely completion and filing of the documents in the residents records, Suicide Prevention Assessment Documentation, Policies and Procedures related to Intake and Admissions. 

The Treatment Director will complete Suicide Screenings and file the documents in the appropriate record by the Treatment Director/Administrator. 

Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the compliance officer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, five child records were reviewed. One child's record had an inaccurate medication count. The record reflected the child had 13 pills, however the medication bottle had only 11 pills.
Correction Narrative:
The operation held a Medication Administration training session that covered topics such as medication records, the 10 Rights for Safe Medication Administration, refusal of medication forms, and procedures for discontinuing and renewing medication. A sign-in sheet confirmed that the training took place over two days (8/28/2024 & 8/30/2024), with an hour-long session each day. 8/30/2024 FD

I conducted an inspection #4020009 on 9/16/2024 and reviewed two child medication records and found them to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing the records of five children, it was found that none included an admission assessment.
Correction Narrative:
Admission/intake staff will be re-educated on admission admission process to include but not limited to: timely completion and filing of the documents in the resident's records, Policies and Procedures related to intake and admissions. 

The files will be filed in the appropriate record by the Treatment Director/Administrator. 

Admission/intake documentation will be reviewed by the compliance officer or designee within 72 hours. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the compliance officer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, four of five child medication records were reviewed and observed to be missing name and signature of person who administered the medication.
Correction Narrative: The operation held a Medication Administration training session that covered topics such as medication records, the 10 Rights for Safe Medication Administration, refusal of medication forms, and procedures for discontinuing and renewing medication. A sign-in sheet confirmed that the training took place over two days (8/28/2024 & 8/30/2024), with an hour-long session each day.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, child records were reviewed, and it was observed three of five children had missed doses of prescription medication. One child did not receive daily allergy medication for 4 days, another child did not receive vitamin D3 and prescription iron supplements for 4 days, and a third child was allowed to take half the dose of his prescription medication.
Correction Narrative:
The operation held a Medication Administration training session that covered topics such as medication records, the 10 Rights for Safe Medication Administration, refusal of medication forms, and procedures for discontinuing and renewing medication. A sign-in sheet confirmed that the training took place over two days (8/28/2024 & 8/30/2024), with an hour-long session each day. 8/30/2024 FD

I conducted an inspection #4020009 on 9/16/2024 and reviewed two child medication records and found them to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, it was noted that three of five records reviewed were missing immunization records.
Correction Narrative:
Admission/intake staff will be re-educated on admission process that include but not limited to timely completion and filing of the documents in the resident's records, Suicide Prevention Assessment Documentation, Obtaining all required medical/preventative screenings before admission, documentation of communication with Case Worker to obtain required documents, Policies and Procedures related to intake and admissions. 

The Treatment Director will continue to communicate with the Case Worker to obtain the TB screening records and document the attempted encounter along with the proof of request in the Resident's communication records. 

Admission/intake documentation will be reviewed by the compliance officer or designee within 72 hours of admission to the facility. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the compliance officer.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing the children's records, it was found that four out of five children did not have a tuberculosis (TB) test on file.
Correction Narrative:
Admission/intake staff will be re-educated on admission process that include but not limited to timely completion and filing of the documents in the resident's records, Suicide Prevention Assessment Documentation, Obtaining all required medical/preventative screenings before admission and TB examinations, documentation of communication with Case Worker to obtain required documents, Policies and Procedures related to intake and admissions. 

The Treatment Director will continue to communicate with the Case Worker to obtain the TB screening records and document the attempted encounter along with the proof of request in the Resident's communication records. 

Admission/intake documentation will be reviewed by the compliance officer or designee within 72 hours of admission to the facility. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the compliance officer.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing children's records, one out of five records did not have a current medical appointment.
Correction Narrative:
The operation sent an email stating the medical appointment was scheduled for UT Urgent Care. The resident refused to go to the appointment. The caseworker was notified. The appropriate documentation was completed and signed by the resident in a timely manner. Th refusal of treatment form was not filed in the resident's record at the time of the inspection. 

Re-educate the staff on timely filing of resident refusal forms in the individual record with 24 hours of the refusal. 

Ongoing quality inspections will be provided by the Administrator and the compliance officer. Ongoing re-education/in-services will be provided by the Administrator or designee as needed.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, one of five child records reviewed was missing the reason medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: The operation held a Medication Administration training session that covered topics such as medication records, the 10 Rights for Safe Medication Administration, refusal of medication forms, and procedures for discontinuing and renewing medication. A sign-in sheet confirmed that the training took place over two days (8/28/2024 & 8/30/2024), with an hour-long session each day.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing the children's records, it was noted that four out of five did not indicate whether the child exhibited any high-risk behaviors.
Correction Narrative:
Admission/intake staff will be re-educated on admission process that include but not limited to timely completion and filing of the documents in the resident's records, Suicide Prevention Assessment Documentation, Obtaining all required medical/preventive screenings before admission, documentation of communication with case workers to obtain required documents, policies and procedures related to intake and admissions. 

Admission/intake documentation will be reviewed by the compliance officer or designee within 72 hours of admission to the facility.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon inspection of the two first aid kits, it was found that one kit lacked a guide for the emergency contents.
The review of the fire drill revealed that there was no designated meeting place established for the drill.
Correction Narrative: The review of the fire drill revealed that there was no designated meeting place established for the drill.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing the records of children, it was found that none of the five records had a preliminary service plan completed within 72 hours of placement.
Correction Narrative:
Admission/intake staff will be re-educated on admission process to include but not limited to: timely completion and filing of the documents in the resident's records, Suicide Prevention Assessment Documentation, 72 hour Service Plan Completion, Policies and Procedures related to intake and admission. 

The administrator will review the 72 hour treatment plan to ensure accuracy. Admission/intake documentation will be reviewed by the compliance officer or designee within 72 hours of admission to the facility. 

Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator and the compliance officer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, the door to the medication closet was unlocked, making all medications (including schedule II) located inside the locked cabinet only single locked.
Correction Narrative:
The operation held a Medication Administration training session that covered topics such as medication records, the 10 Rights for Safe Medication Administration, refusal of medication forms, and procedures for discontinuing and renewing medication. A sign-in sheet confirmed that the training took place over two days (8/28/2024 & 8/30/2024), with an hour-long session each day. 8/30/2024 FD

I conducted an inspection #4020009 on 9/16/2024 and reviewed two child medication records and found them to be compliant. All doors to the medication room were locked and medications were appropriately locked in the medication room.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the three records reviewed failed to have reference checks completed by unrelated individuals. Both records included two reference checks completed by relatives.
Correction Narrative: All current employee files will be audited by the HR Manager to ensure the Employment Verification Form is completed as per the regulations. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the three records reviewed failed to document diligent efforts to contact an employment reference. The document indicates that three attempts were made dated for the same date not indicating times to verify attempts made.
Correction Narrative: All current employee files will be audited by the HR Manager to ensure the Applicant/Employee references are checked to ensure suitability to work with children. The results of the reference check will be documented on the agency's form and placed in the employee's record and include the date, time, and initials of the person making the contact. The HR Manager will be re-educated on the documentation required for compliance by the Administrator and CEO by 6/4/2024. Ongoing quality monitoring will be provided by the Administrator.

Deficiency Narrative: The abuse and neglect policy did not include strategies for coordinating between the operation and appropriate community organizations.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy to reflect community organizations they will coordinate services with.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation created a Postvention Team, written action plan and protocols, however, they did not indicate the specific job titles of each individual included on the postvention team.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy to reflect specific job titles of each individual included on the postvention team.

Deficiency Narrative: The child care policy does not indicate whether the operation admits or cares for a pregnant child.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated policy indicating the operation does not admit or provide services for a pregnant child.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the four staff folders reviewed did not have a statement dated and signed indicating the individual has read a copy of the operational policies.
Correction Narrative: The operation provides signed and dated documents indicating the employee has read a copy of the operational policies.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy failed to include how the operation will explain and document to a child the way to provide voluntary comments during or after an EBI.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy to reflect during  orientation a child will be informed how to provide voluntary comments during or after EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation requires the forms; however, they do not indicate how they will maintain the records.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy to reflect documentation will be maintained in the employees record.

Deficiency Narrative: There is a form included in the policies for the specified individuals to sign stating they will not disclose any information regarding children in care, however, the document does not include an explanation any form of explanation that the children's confidentiality is protected by law, and it is their obligation to maintain and protect that privacy.
Correction Narrative: The operation the policy to reflect the responsibility of personnel to maintain confidentiality to a child's information.

Deficiency Narrative: The child care policy does not indicate whether the operation offers any religious programs or activities, or whether children must participate.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the policy to reflect the operation offers a voluntary non-denominational spiritual program, however, children do not have to attend. The child's religious/non-religious practices will be respected.

Deficiency Narrative: The EBI policy states that the operation uses CPI, however, they do not include a descriptor of the curriculum for the system.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated policy including the descriptions of the CPI EBI training curriculum, and the number of hours and training required for each level employee.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy did not include the process for a child to make written comments after an EBI.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated policy indicating the child could discuss privately, however, didn't include how the child could make written comments after an EBI. The operation was given until close of business 4/1/2024 to address these concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: During the standard by standard it was observed the mock children's file did not have an initial service plan.
During the standard by standard it was observed there was no mock preliminarily service plan.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a copy of a mock Preliminary Service Plan form that met the requirements of 748.1331(a).

Deficiency Narrative: The suicide policy did not indicated which screening tool the operation would be utilizing.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy indicating they will utilize the Columbian Protocol Screening Tool, also known as the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS).

Deficiency Narrative: The tobacco products and E-Cigarettes policy prohibits the use of drugs, alcohol, and tobacco; however, it does not prohibit the possession of these products.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the policy to reflect not only does the operation prohibit the use of these products by children, but also the possession of the listed products.

Deficiency Narrative: The EBI policy did not include the qualifications for caregivers who assume the responsibility for EBI implementation.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the EBI policy to reflects the trainer responsibilities and what the trainer will provide, but does not specify that these are the qualifications for the caregiver to assume responsibility for EBI implementation.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation does not have a formal policy regarding drug testing. The operation provided a drug and alcohol testing consent form.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a written drug testing policy.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not indicate which suicide screening tool the operation will utilize in the policy.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy to describe the suicide risk screening tool they will use and the process for implementing screenings.
The operation provided a copy of a mock discharge form that included all the sections in 748.1439 (b)(1)(A)-(F).

Deficiency Narrative: There is a policy related to code of conduct, however, it does not include the parameters for entering into financial relationships or transactions.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated conflict of interest policy that addressing entering into financial relationships or transactions.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy included a flow chart that shows a straight-line declination of positions, however, it does not specify the lines of responsibility and to whom each report. The written staffing pattern doesn't indicate this information either.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the organizational flow chart that reflects which the chain of command in the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: All staff folders reviewed included the name of references with their prospective telephone numbers and titles. There was no indication that these individuals have been contacted and due to no results of the contacts.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided documentation indicating contact was made to two references to verify that the applicant is suitable to work with or around children for the staff records reviewed.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection one of the bedrooms windows had a window that was painted and did not provide natural lighting.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a photo showing the bedroom window no longer had paint on it and was opened provided natural lighting.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough at the standard by standards inspection, I observed the two roaches in the administration room at the facility.  One of the two roaches were alive.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a copy of a pest control agreement indicating that services were rendered at the operation on 3/15/2024 to exterminate the property.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy failed to state that the majority of members of the governing body must consist of persons who do not have a conflict of interest.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the policy to reflect a statement that the majority of the members of the governing body must consist of persons who do not have a conflict of interest.

Deficiency Narrative: The abuse and neglect policy does not include methods for increasing employee awareness of prevention techniques for child abuse and neglect.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy to reflect methods for increasing employee awareness and prevention techniques for child abuse and neglect through pre-service training, refresher training, and additional training if the need arises.

Deficiency Narrative: The policy did not include a statement indicating that restraints should be used as preventive measures and de-escalating interventions to avoid EBI.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their EBI policy to indicates the process is to use the de-escalation practices noted in the policy before using a more restrictive and intrusive behavior intervention or emergency intervention.

Deficiency Narrative: The EBI policy did not include that Post EBIs permitted at the operation would be viewable to children/clients and will provide them with a personal copy of EBI policies.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an update of the EBI policy indicating a copy of the EBI permitted will be posted on a bulletin in the hallways and will be viewable to residents.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four staff folders reviewed had a notarized Affidavit for Applicants for Employment, but the form did not indicate the individuals name that the form was being notarized for.  Another of the four staff folders reviewed did not have an Affidavit on file.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided copies of notarized Licensing Affidavit for Applicants for Employment.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff folders did not have a signed and dated form indicating that an employee must immediately report any suspected incident of child abuse, neglect and exploitation to the Texas Abuse and Neglect Hotline and to the operations administrator or designee.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a document that was signed and dated by staff indicating they will immediately report suspected child abuse, neglect, and exploitation.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the four staff folders reviewed had the Pre-Employment Screening Template that indicated names of former employers with their prospective telephone numbers and titles. There was no indication that these individuals have been contacted and due to no results of the contacts.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided documentation reflecting contact was made to the employer to verify that the applicant was employed as described in the applicant's employment history.
